page.title: 14INVERMORISTON:CUSTOMS
page.content: NEW YEAR in Invermoriston. Hogmanay is a time to celebrate the coming of the New Year by visiting or being visited by as many friends as possible. The first person to visit a house after midnight in the new year is the "first-foot"and should preferably be a dark -haired man to bring good luck. First-footers take gifts signifying plenty to the house,(traditionally a lump of peat or coal)and nowadays also whisky or shortbread.At each house first-footers are welcomed with a drink and a piece of black bun(rich fruit cake in a pastry crust),or shortbread.First-footing goes on all night and may stretch over the next day or two of the new year.
